title: [Large-Scale] Understanding Emotional Dynamics in VR-Based Mathematics Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematics concepts and experience using digital devices
context.additional_context: A blended learning environment combining VR simulations and online discussion sessions, providing personalized feedback considering learners' individual emotion-regulation strategies.

learning_goals: Learners can identify primary emotions (joy, anger, sadness) occurring during math problem-solving in VR simulation environments with 80% accuracy
Learners can explain the impact of personality traits (conscientiousness, agreeableness) and self-regulated emotion (SRE) strategies (reappraisal, suppression) on VR learning experiences
Learners can develop and apply two or more personalized SRE strategies to reduce negative emotions during VR-based learning
Learners can demonstrate math problem-solving strategies considering emotional dynamics in VR learning environments through project-based assessments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
